page.title: 09Laverstock Secondary School.
page.content: St Edmund's C.E. Secondary Modern School for girls was built in 1962 to take some 750 pupils from the East Salisbury and Downton Catchment Area. Their ages range from 11 to 16 years. School starts at 9.00a.m.with an assembly. Lessons start at 9.40 and last for 35 minutes.There are 8 lessons in one day and you have 2 breaks lasting 15 and 10 minutes.The dinner break is 70 minutes long and you have the use of a playground and when it's fine, the fairly large field. There are 35 teachers, both men and women.There are five science laboratories, two art rooms, a drama studio, three home economics rooms and a gym, among other rooms. The school has a very good library with a large selection of books for all ages.{The {school is very friendly and has a good {reputation helping the public locally.
